title: ExcelUndo and Redo

metadata.description: Learn about ExcelUndo and Redo with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Undo
The Undo function lets you reverse an action.
Undo is helpful if you regret an action and want to go back to how it was before.
Examples of use
Undo deleting a formula
Undo adding a column
Undo removing a row
Note:
You cannot Undo things that you do in the File Menu, such as deleting a sheet, saving a spreadsheet or changing the options. The thumb rule is that you can Undo things you do in your sheet.
There are two ways to access the Undo command.
1) Pressing the Undo button in the Ribbon:
2) Using the keyboard shortcut CTRL + Z / Command + Z
Let's have a look at an example:
Note: It is recommended to practice using the keyboard shortcut. It saves you time!
Redo
The Redo function has the opposite effect as Undo, it reverses the Undo action.
Redo is helpful if you regret using Undo.
Note:
The Redo command is only available if you have used Undo.
There are two ways to access the Redo command.
1) Pressing the Redo button in the Ribbon:
2) Using the keyboard shortcut CTRL + Y / Command + Y
Tip:
Practice for yourself to get familiar with Undo and Redo.
Test Yourself With Exercises
Excel Exercise:
Complete the keyboard shortcut for the Undo command (for Windows and MAC):
CTRL +
Command +

quiz.question: What is Undo?
options: helpful if you regret an action and want to go back to how it was before
that you can Undo things you do in your sheet
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of Undo is 'helpful if you regret an action and want to go back to how it was before'.

quiz.question: What is The thumb rule?
options: that you can Undo things you do in your sheet
helpful if you regret an action and want to go back to how it was before
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of The thumb rule is 'that you can Undo things you do in your sheet'.

summary: This tutorial covers ExcelUndo and Redo concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use ExcelUndo and Redo effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of ExcelUndo and Redo and how to apply it in your projects.
